result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 274 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant is not to possess a firearm and may not vote until his rights are restored.
Defendant to register as a sex offender.
No contact with the victim or her family.
Continue with any sex offender treatment.
DNA sample to be provided.

State to submit a restitution amount in 30 days. A hearing is set for 1/09/2015 at 1:30pm.

AS OF 2/19/2015: Restitution is set at ZERO.

Defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo in court, in custody, via video with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson from SWITS appeared to interpret and sworn. State advises the insurance company paid the victim and the victim is not requesting restitution. Insurance company is not present at 3:35 p.m..  Court orders that the prior order of restitution set at zero stands.
Restitution hearing on February 19, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Restitution hearing on February 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Erik I. Colque in court.   Defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo did not appear.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreters do not appear. State addresses the insurance companies absence. State advises restitution should be set at zero for the insurance company. Court orders restitution be set at Zero for the Insurance Company. State advises the Victim is requesting $160.00. Court will set another date in 30 days for restitution hearing on the victim's request. If Attorney's reach an agreement a stipulation is to be filed by Defense and State a week before the next date. OTP TO BE PREPARED A WEEK BEFORE THE NEXT DATE IF PARTIES HAVE NOT REACHED AN AGREEMENT. INTERPRETER TO BE NOTIFIED OF THE NEXT DATE.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Restitution hearing on January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo in court, in custody, with attorney Erik I. Colque.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. Interpreter Sylvie Dahnert appeared on behalf of the victim. Court takes a short recess. Court reconvenes. Victim continues with her statement. State to submit a restitution figure in 30 days. Court will set a restitution hearing in January. Interpreter to be notified to appear.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 9 years (Initial Confinement: 4 years - 274 days credit, Extended Supervision:  5 years)  
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail consecutive 
- State to submit a restitution figure in 30 days - hearing has been set. 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Defendant is not to possess a firearm and may not vote until his rights are restored. Defendant to register as a sex offender.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school. No contact with the victim or her family. Continue with any sex offender treatment.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo in court, in custody, with attorney Erik I. Colque.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Court orders bail revoked.  Court sets matter over for sentencing on 11/12/2014 at 2:00 p.m..

Defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo in court, in custody, with attorney Erik I. Colque.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter and sworn in.  Defense is set for trail and would like to proceed as such.  Court advises the parties that Reserve Judge Nettesheim will preside.  Court addresses the Motions in Limine; they are to be heard by trial Judge.  Defense and State agree this will be a two day trail.  Case proceeds as set.

Defendant Roberto Galindo Segundo in court, in custody.  Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Defendant did not apply for Public Defender representation, because a family member retained an attorney for him, but he does not know who the attorney is. Defendant's friend advised court that a cousin or family member retained an attorney for the defendant, but does not know who the attorney is. Court passes case for defendant's friend to find out who represents hiim. Case recalled at 1:57 p.m. Same appearances. Defendant still does not know who was retained to represent him. Court sets matter over for status of counsel.  Patrick Ryan is not available for court tomorrow, another interpreter will need to appear at next hearing.   Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
